TopicTitle: Looking for a nice Grand Tour Video on Youtube. Can anyone recommend ?

Articles.Content:
Hey all, I am back from watching the Martian tonight and I just want to watch KSP stuff.

I'm looking for a nice Grand Tour video on youtube.

The best I've found so far are super quick 3min grand tours, or series that stops after 4 episodes (most promising one stopped after his first stop on Eve).

Right now watching a 4h long stream (so lots of Fast-Forward to keep interested, urrgh).

If you have any suggestions, post them and I'll check 'em out.

I prefer stock, but it's not a deal breaker.

If it has the outer planets installed or 1/10th RSS you could say it's worth bonus points.

Looking for a series of episodes rather than one humongous videos that cuts out all maneuvers and all the fun stuff.

I did not think finding quality grand tour videos would be so hard to do. I guess I'll have to pester a few youtubers to do a complete one... Dunno who'd have the time for it tho.

Anyways thanks, and I recommend "The Martian" if you haven't seen it... some parts of the film are Kerbal-Worthy but still fit well within the film.

This was in video Wednesday a few months back and is completely amazing.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128659-Seat-of-the-Pants-Industries-presents-The-Jetpack-Grand-Tour

Check out the Jool 5 challenge. Two people recently completed it with an ISRU grand tour, and one was a video. (EvermoreAlpaca, here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123950-THE-ULTIMATE-JOOL-5-CHALLENGE-Continuation-for-KSP-1-0%21?p=2226001&viewfull=1#post2226001)
How about a grand tour via jetpack?
I come in here to link my video and sdj64 is already on it! <3

This was in video Wednesday a few months back and is completely amazing.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128659-Seat-of-the-Pants-Industries-presents-The-Jetpack-Grand-Tour

Okay, just watched that one... not what I was looking for but amazing nonetheless. Thanks.

Too bad he did not post the list of mods he used (I guess that was EVE ? Anyways it looked so damned good).

Edited October 13, 2015 by Francois424
